meanings.definition: To go beyond the limits of what is considered acceptable or moral.
meanings.sent1: He knew he would transgress the rules if he stayed out past curfew.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to transgress the boundaries of good behavior.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy seemed to transgress every rule in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her actions seemed to transgress the very essence of decency.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of his transgression were severe and lasting.

meanings.definition: To violate a law or commandment.
meanings.sent1: The thief decided to transgress the law and steal the valuable painting.
meanings.sent2: It is never right to transgress the commandments given for our well-being.
meanings.sent3: The rebellious teenager thought it was cool to transgress the school rules.
meanings.sent4: His decision to transgress the rules of nature led to disastrous consequences.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of her transgression were felt throughout the community.
